跟.definition: heel; to follow closely; to go with; (of a woman) to marry sb; with; compared with; to; towards; and (joining two nouns)

跟上.definition: to catch up with; to keep pace with

跟不上.definition: not able to keep up with

跟前.definition: (of children, parents etc) at one's side; living with one

跟包.definition: to work as footman; to do odd jobs; to understudy (an opera actor)

跟團遊.definition: to travel in a tour group

跟屁股.definition: to tag along behind; to follow sb closely

跟屁蟲.definition: lit. bum beetle; sb who tags along; shadow; sycophant

跟從.definition: to follow; (of a woman) to get married; (old) attendant

跟手.definition: (coll.) while doing it; on the way through; (coll.) immediately; at once; (of a touch screen) responsive to the user's finger movements

跟拍.definition: to document on film the course of events; to follow sb with a camera

跟注.definition: to match a bet; to call (poker)

跟監.definition: (Tw) to tail (sb) (abbr. for 跟蹤監視|跟踪监视[gen1 zong1 jian1 shi4])

跟腱.definition: heel tendon of mammals; Achilles tendon

跟腳.definition: to feet the feet perfectly; to follow closely; hard on sb's heels

跟蹤.definition: to follow sb's tracks; to tail; to shadow; tracking

跟風.definition: to go with the tide; to blindly follow the crowd; to follow the trend
